sub_topic: Show that every group of order 40 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C40, the dihedral group D20, or one of the eight non-abelian groups of order 40.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 40 are there, and what are they?

3. If Q is isomorphic to Z_2^3, there are 4 possible actions of Q on P, but one of them is trivial, which leads to the direct product Z_2 * Z_20. So, there are 3 non-abelian groups in this case.
